work.p: This manuscript relates to the poem first published as "After All, Not to Create Only" in 1871. The poem was ultimately titled "Song of the Exposition."

titleStmt.title: a chorus of
a machine readable transcription
titleStmt.author: Walt Whitman

notesStmt.note: This manuscript was likely written in 1871 after Whitman accepted the invitation from the American Institute to compose and recite a poem at the opening of its fortieth Annual Exhibition in New York City. Whitman read the poem on September 7, 1871, and it was published soon after that in several newspapers and in a small book.
The verso of the manuscript leaf has Department of Justice letterhead.
